snippet: Thousands of minority applicants who weren’t hired by the New York Fire Department, whose screening exam a judge called discriminatory, could split as much as $128 million.
abstract: Federal Judge Nicholas G Garaufis orders New York City to pay as much as $128 million in back wages to minority applicants who were never hired; ruling comes after more than four years of litigation in which the city and the Fire Department were accused of discriminatory testing procedures.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of minority applicants who weren’t hired by the New York Fire Department, whose screening exam a judge called discriminatory, could split as much as $128 million.

headline.seo: City Ordered to Provide Back Pay in Fire Dept. Bias Case
